column5: i have some of those to with the eyes. i have some white ones that glow in the dark. pretty old lures and i cant say ive ever got them wet. if someone wants them pm me.
Pm sent WD ty.  Art, the ones I posted, I got from that site. Im going to call them Friday to make sure their the ones Im looking for.
I have one Brian.. But I'm keeping it.. lol Good luck in your search..

You know the banana shaped jig. For some reason I can find their new style,but it,s not what I want. I cant even find it on thier site. It,s like 2 inches long and banana shaped.  If anyone knows where to buy or of a mold out there,I would be thankful.  B.
Have you looked at luremaking.com catalogue online? They have quite a few styles.
Is it a jig or a spoon?
Brian calls it a SPIG
post a pic B with someing there for a ref. like a coin.
Is it the rocker minnow?    They stopped making them about 3 years ago. I bought out the last 10 or so from Zellers here in North Bay.
Ya 5.99 a peice. NOT      I had a guy years ago make them for me and I painted them myself.

I have some of those which I bought from Dennis at Bass Haven on Mitchells Bay a few years ago. My understanding was that he made them himself. I know he is still in business, but I am not sure if he still makes the Jig A Whopper.  Good Luck
This is what came to mind when I read JIGAWOPPER:    The white one is a knock-off. The other three are genuine and no, you may not have them.  They haven't been made for about ten years.
I have 3 brand new ones. Blue, pink, and chartruse. I have another blue one that is still in the package. I hae one of the bent ones too. I thought it was a crippled herring?
PM sent  Michael
They are all bent. I put the one on end to show the profile.  They have JIGAWOPPER imprinted on them.
O.K. the rocker minnows I have are bent slightly but I didn't think that much. I'll have to check the "bent" one I have. I don't think it says jig-a-wopper on it.
YA I HAVE THE SAME ONES AS KICKINGFROG

Those are popular here...  I'll check the local shop... I'm 99% sure they have them  Might be knock offs... Not sure...but they are banana jigs just like in your picture... With a single through hook..  I think they will ship em too  Any specific colors your looking for?
Mike you could check with Gib , he has'nt left yet to come up , he would be happy to bring them up and i could drop them off to Brian..... just a thought if that worked for every one .
Thanks Guys.  Ron thats nice of ya,seems I found a guy that knows a guy that has them.  Oh and Rob,may your spud bar go down a hole.
I was also looking for Jig-A-Woppers but have had no luck. The kind I'm looking for are in the photo below.

Awesome spoon Rob, it's my favourite jigging spoon hands down. I still have a handful left, all well used.     That would be the Hawger spoon I believe. I have a bunch and still use them regularly and they catch fish too.  Sorry I think you'll be fortunate to find a source for these spoons.   Brian those banana shaped jigs are pretty common. I actually think I do have some made by jig a whopper and some other brands as well.  Exactly what sizes do you want? I never use these anymore, whatever I've got you can have.

Thanks Mike  Roughly about an inch and a half.  Hands down,they are my favorite ice jig for walleye.   Was going through the online cataloge and found a mold,but it dosent say what size they are,just the weight. Going to give them a call later today.
1.21 JIGGOWATTS!!!!

I have been looking for this spoon also. Tromblys has them in perch size but I want one in trout / whitie size. I had one years ago and got my first decent laker on it but it seemd to have walked away somewhere.

I stumble across those Hawger spoons every so often at various tackle shops and even TSC.  Never seen a good selection though.  Came across these Jig-a-Whopper lures recently.  They did not come with hooks.
Those are sweet looking.
See if this is what you are looking for Brian jig a whopper .htm P.M. me if you need help getting them up North.   Art
